name: Data Fundamentals

topics.description: This topic explores different data types, such as numerical, categorical, and textual data. Learners will understand the characteristics of each type and how they are represented in computer systems. This knowledge is crucial for selecting appropriate data structures and performing accurate data analysis.
references: Tan, P. (2018). Introduction to Data Mining. Pearson Education.
Widdows, D. (2019). Data Structures and Algorithms in Python (3rd ed.). Routledge.

topics.description: This topic focuses on fundamental SQL commands for data manipulation, including SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE. Learners will be able to retrieve, modify, and delete data from relational databases, a core skill for working with structured data.
references: Elmasri, R., & Navathe, S. B. (2017). Fundamentals of Database Systems (7th ed.). Pearson Education.
Crockford, D. (2013). SQL tutorial. Retrieved from https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SQL

topics.description: This topic introduces common charting tools and techniques for visualizing data. Learners will be able to create various charts, such as bar charts, line charts, and scatter plots, to effectively communicate data patterns and trends. Visualizations are essential for understanding complex datasets and making data-driven decisions.
references: Cleveland, W. S. (1993). Visualizing Data. Hobart Press.
Tufte, E. R. (2001). The Visual Display of Quantitative Information. Graphics Press.

topics.description: This topic covers fundamental statistical concepts such as mean, median, mode, standard deviation, and correlation. Learners will understand how to calculate these measures and interpret their meaning in the context of data analysis. These concepts are crucial for making informed inferences and drawing meaningful conclusions from data.
references: Agresti, A. (2015). An Introduction to Statistical Methods and Data Analysis (7th ed.). Pearson Education.
Moore, D. S., McCabe, G. P., & Craig, B. A. (2012). Introduction to the Practice of Statistics (7th ed.). W. H. Freeman.

topics.description: This topic delves into data cleaning and preprocessing techniques, addressing common issues such as missing values, outliers, and inconsistent formatting. Learners will understand how to handle these issues effectively to ensure data quality and accuracy for subsequent analysis. Proper data cleaning is essential for obtaining reliable and meaningful results.
references: James, G., Witten, D., Hastie, T., & Tibshirani, R. (2013). An Introduction to Statistical Learning. Springer.
Zuur, A. F., Ieno, E. N., Walker, N., Saveliev, A. A., & Smith, G. M. (2009). Mixed Effects Models and Experimental Design. Springer.

topics.description: This topic introduces basic data structures, such as arrays, lists, and dictionaries, and explains how they are used to organize and store data. Learners will understand the advantages and disadvantages of each structure and when to use them appropriately. A strong grasp of data structures is fundamental for efficient data processing and manipulation.
references: Sedgewick, R., & Wayne, K. (2011). Introduction to Algorithms (3rd ed.). Addison-Wesley.
Cormen, T. H., Leiserson, C. E., Rivest, R. L., & Stein, C. (2009). Introduction to Algorithms (3rd ed.). MIT Press.

topics.description: This topic explores different data analysis techniques, including descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, and hypothesis testing. Learners will understand how to apply these techniques to explore data patterns, identify relationships, and make inferences. These techniques are essential for gaining insights from data and supporting data-driven decision-making.
references: Gelman, A., & Hill, J. (2007). Data Analysis Using Regression and Multilevel Models. Cambridge University Press.
Kass, R. E., & Raftery, A. E. (1995). Bayes factors. Journal of the American Statistical Association, 90(430), 773-795.

description: This module introduces core data concepts, including data types, structures, and analysis techniques. It covers essential tools for data manipulation and exploration.
aims: Define and differentiate various data types.
Apply basic data manipulation techniques using SQL.
Interpret and visualize data using common charting tools.
Understand fundamental statistical concepts for data analysis.
